intro: Dicoryphe retusa, commonly known as the smoothleaf dicoryphe, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its root system is fibrous, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Dicoryphe retusa is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
